thread.title: Jamie Vardy’s goal sparks social media meltdown as the party is back on
thread.title_full: Jamie Vardy’s goal sparks social media meltdown as the party is back on

author: Rebecca Knight
title: Jamie Vardy’s goal sparks social media meltdown as the party is back on
text:
Jamie Vardy’s goal sparks social media meltdown as the party is back on By Rebecca Knight   The party is on! 
Leicester City looked down and out after they went two goals down in the Champions League against Leicester City – but they managed to get a precious away goal and a lifeline through Jamie Vardy. 
The striker, who gathered a cult following last season has been poor this term, and while there were plenty of people ready to stick the knife in, there were also many fans who jumped in to defend him. 
His wife managed to get a dig in about the service he’s received, the Jamie Vardy movie, the failed move to Arsenal, and some stats were also thrown in for good measure. 
The party on social media was impressive in its own right – and here’s the best of it. The best of Twitter Jamie Vardy says he has 'no regrets' about not joining Arsenal (again). I worked it out, that makes more comments about Arsenal than goals 
— Daily Cannon (@DailyCannon) February 22, 2017 GOAL: Jamie Vardy scores a crucial away goal for Leicester! ⚽️ pic.twitter.com/Yh0JGJv2eH Jamie Vardy has scored his first goal in 748 minutes of football across all competitions. 
Huge away goal. pic.twitter.com/E6RNB55F0u 
— Squawka Football (@Squawka) February 22, 2017 Remember when Vardy, Musa and Mahrez used to run. 
— Miguel Delaney (@MiguelDelaney) February 22, 2017 Get in you beauty. Massive goal for Vardy and Leicester. 
— Gary Lineker (@GaryLineker) February 22, 2017 The year is 2019. 
The Jamie Vardy movie premiere is taking place. 
It ends with him getting booed off after a 0-0 draw at Fleetwood. pic.twitter.com/Hu4LpC4k55 Guess that's what happens when you get 'service' Jamie Vardy… has only gone and scored against the mighty sevilla!! what a LAD!! 
— Paul Tooth (@PaulTooth22) February 22, 2017 Vardy scoring an away goal. Like when you're getting bored and thinking of leaving but the host sticks your favourite song on. #VardyParty 
— Football Tips (@footballtips) February 22, 2017 So this season Vardy has only scored vs Sevilla away, (a hat-trick) vs City, at Anfield, vs Swansea & in the Community Shield. ¯_(ツ)_/¯ 
— Nick Sculley (@sculls_6) February 22, 2017 @FOXXXI those are the same idiots who walk how jamie vardy celebrates and think that Drake's one of the greats looool
